greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle whose rows are sequences of increasing and decreasing squares: 1; 1,4,1; 1,4,9,4,1; ...
comment: The triangle A003983 with individual entries squared and each 2nd row skipped.
T(n,k) =  min(n,k)^2. The order of the list T(n,k) is by sides of squares from T(1,n) to T(n,n), then from T(n,n) to T(n,1). - _Boris Putievskiy_, Jan 13 2013
link: Boris Putievskiy, Transformations Integer Sequences And Pairing Functions arXiv:1212.2732 [math.CO]
example: The start of the sequence as table:
The start of the sequence as triangle array read by rows:
maple: A003983 := proc(n,k) min(n,k) ; end: A124258 := proc(n,k) A003983(n,k)^2 ; end: for d from 1 to 20 by 2 do for c from 1 to d do printf("%d, ",A124258(d+1-c,c)) ; od: od: # _R. J. Mathar_, Sep 21 2007
results.author: _Jonathan Vos Post_, Dec 16 2006
ext: More terms from _R. J. Mathar_, Sep 21 2007
